revised_title: Tides at the Port of London: Observations and Analysis
tldr: This paper presents 19 years of tide observations at the London Docks, with a focus on the moon's transit two days prior to high water. The author, J.W. Lubbock, discusses the relationship between high water height and atmospheric pressure, as indicated by the barometer, and considers the influence of wind on tides. The findings support Bernoulli's views on tide phenomena.
